title: How is this considered as toxic????
body:
I love how even this count as toxic??? I mean all I said were 17 sentences, while the other guy was literally flaming/blaming at me and said probably 30-40.  Like you can even tell this guy kept telling me to stay bronze and shouldn't play this game. And what's wrong telling him "flaming wont get u got?" Trying to tell him not to flame and just play.  Come on, this Riot system is so broken. I didn't start it as well. 
Silver412: pinged like 100 times
Silver412: lol
Silver412: who knows where he went
Silver412: top was pushed as well
Silver412: just have some map awareness
Silver412: so u can get out of silver
Silver412: report salty yi
Silver412: cant stop flaming xD
Silver412: sorry im not bronze
Silver412: i know u are hard stuck
Silver412: but u need to be better
Silver412: to get out
Silver412: and flaming wont get u out
Silver412: : )
Silver412: if toxic make u feels betteer
Silver412: go ahead
Silver412: <3

replies.body:
1. told other people to report someone..

2. demeaned a player by inferring his rank negated or lessened his position and that he needed to be better

3. arguing in team chat ruins the experience of the other players on your team

Well , the thing is he is the one who started flaming at me for 20 minutes, so I can't even tell to stop flaming and ask my teammates to report him for toxic? I mean if he is not toxic, then my statement to have my teammates report won't do harm to him.  I also don't like how Roit won't show what he said so I can copy and paste it here. He also told me to stay bronze, and said all kinds of offense things. 

The point I'm trying to make is, I'M A HUMAN after all. I do get mad when people flamed and blamed me. So I do try to explain it for myself and hope he will not flame me anymore. I even told him not to flame, so I guess this is also wrong?

> so I can't even tell to stop flaming 

Sure, you can say stop flaming, and then you should mute him. What you can't continue to do is...

> ask my teammates to report him for toxic

...derail the game for the rest of your team. Your report is enough.

> I'M A HUMAN after all

Being human is knowing when to keep your actions under control, be the bigger person, and not escalate a situation. Let idiots be idiots. If an idiot is flaming you, **ignore the idiot**. You can't stop idiots from idioting.

First of all, I do want to appreciate your help to comment on my situation. But, using your logic or standard, aren't you doing the exact same thing I was doing tho? You ask me "be the bigger person” which is implying that I'm not a bigger person. You also used the word "idiots" to describe me and the other players. And, you want me to stop "idoiting". Isn't what you just said a more severe violation of Riot honor code than I did? Should you be therefore banned from commenting on any posts for 2 weeks?

Not trying to said you are toxic, just saying how can small things or words like that count toward a report and issue punishment. People are doing the exact same thing every day probably un-purposely just like you did. There are real toxic people out there they should punish.

No, someone telling you that your behavior was indeed as bad as Riot claimed it is when that's exactly what you asked for help with is not being toxic. And no, he didn't call you an idiot. Also, no, Boards behavior rules are not the same as in-game behavior rules.

Your behavior was bad and you should feel bad instead of using juvenile excuses like "I didn't start it."

Sure, I guess the league of legend is the Utopia, and everyone is being super nice and respectful to others.  Even telling the other guy to stop flaming at me counts as an argument that ruins the lives of innocent players in the team. I know board behavior rules are not the same as in-game behavior rules. I was using it as an example to understand the logic there. 

If by your standard, my behavior was bad. What about the other guy? I will take the punishment as you said I can't use the juvenile excuses like "i didn't start it", then I ask Roit to issue the same punishment or more severe punishment to people who started it and spent 10- 15 minutes flaming at me. Do you think that will be more fair?

Your punishment isn't about everyone. It's about you, and what you did was a lot more than just asking someone to stop flaming. You started flaming them right back, and that does annoy teammates, which is why it's punishable.

Your punishment isn't about the other guy. It's about you.

And speaking of him, his offenses ARE minor. We know that. We know if he continues it, he'll get banned. And we both know that isn't what the intent of the system was years ago when it was created.

He *should not* get banned for this if he continues.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7YV0LxT8,comment-id=00000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-12T04:14:16.556+0000)

> 
> He *should not* get banned for this if he continues.

No, "we" do not know that. You believe that. Riot, most of the playerbase, and I disagree. As for what someone "should" get banned for, your opinion of the rules is of zero relevance. When a cop stops you for going 40 in a 25 zone, you can claim "I think the limit should be 45 here" all you want. You're still getting a ticket. If a librarian asks you to keep your voice down while you use the facilities, shouting that libraries should be loud will simply get you escorted out. If you go to a friend's house who insists that you remove your shoes while you're in their home, "that's a stupid rule and I do what I want" will lose you a friend. If you are using someone else's services, facilities, equipment, etc., you abide by their rules or you deal with the consequences. If you think the rules should change, that is a completely different conversation (and I wouldn't give a plugged nickel for your chances at convincing Riot to change their rules to allow behavior like OP's).

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024051193-Understanding-Different-Ban-Types-FAQs):

> We work with the overall community and within our own company guidelines to identify what disruptive behavior is and what the consequences for those behaviors should be. We understand that it can be difficult to know where the line is, which is why we provide chat logs and we have a few tiers in the ban process in order to allow for you to learn and grow.

I understand what you're saying. Rules are rules.

If you were to be proportional to my argument, though, your example would be, "I was going 45 in a 40, and you're giving me a ticket?" Police officers have openly admitted that laws are strict enough that it is not a question of a citizen being law-abiding or not, but *how long they have to be followed before they break a law.* In League, the system is similarly forgiving, that the rule arbitration system does not slap fines on every infraction automatically detected.

I am heartened by your admiration for the punishment system, but my argument is *rules should not be absolute except in the extreme cases*. You do not recognize Silver142's logs as minor, so let's look at it in painstaking detail.

Silver412: pinged like 100 times
-This is clearly an exaggeration, but requires context to understand it's intent. Without context, it is harmless.
 
Silver412: lol
-Again requires context to understand it's meaning. We don't even know if it's tied to the ping comment.

Silver412: who knows where he went
-A question or statement that is harmless.

Silver412: top was pushed as well
-A statement, harmless.

Silver412: just have some map awareness
-A suggestion, which may be read to imply the player had no map awareness, but does not explicitly. Strictly speaking, not harmful.

Silver412: so u can get out of silver
-Strictly speaking, this is not rank shaming. Anything suggesting otherwise is the imagination of the reader. This is equivalent to saying "so to raise your rank above silver". Silver412 IS SILVER.

Silver412: report salty yi
-Finally an infraction. Calling for reporting is a relatively minor offense that by itself is unlikely to result in punishment. However, that's just popular opinion, if enough people are reporting calling for reporting, then it is not so minor. I think we can agree that calling for reports is morally a minor offense.

Silver412: cant stop flaming xD
-A comment that stand alone could be read as very toxic if referring to self, but is assuredly reasoning for reporting yi. Stand alone, it does not provide a subject, and it must be put into context for understanding what the subject is. To assume it could be the user would be erroneous. Thus the offense level remains minimal so far.

Silver412: sorry im not bronze
-A defensive statement, indirectly referring to his own rank.

Silver412: i know u are hard stuck
-A comment suggesting the subject hasn't improved in some time. Mildly toxic at worst.

Silver412: but u need to be better
-Another comment that is the same as the last in severity. 

Silver412: to get out
-Again, not rank shaming, and is a factual statement. The subject must be better to improve rank. Harmless.

Silver412: and flaming wont get u out
-Once again an accusation of the subject's misbehavior, tying it as a reason to failure to improve. 2nd reference to flaming, certainly doesn't constitute spam.

Silver412: : )
- : ) - What is a smile? A miserable little pile of secrets?

Silver412: if toxic make u feels betteer
-Third time suggesting the subject's behavior is negative, but this time implying it is the choice of the subject to do so and essentially granting the subject leave to continue under the premise that it is helping them. Least toxic of the three statements suggesting negative behavior.

Silver412: go ahead
-Harmless, under any interpretation.

Silver412: <3
- <3


Combining the statements, we have 3 statements accusing a subject of negativity, two that *imply* a lack of skill (map awareness) and two hard suggesting the lack of ability to improve, and a call to report. Each of these were stated in a mild manner, and each infraction is a minor offense. Nothing was spammed and in the end the user was relatively respectful of the subject's ... right ... to be hostile.

Combining the statements in a contextual manner is inane, because we know the system doesn't work that way. I believe the only possible non-minor statement could be taken as such if taken out of context, and thus, the entirety of this log is a minor case. 

Do you disagree?

The IFS is tuned to what most of the player base considers toxic, not to what you personally consider toxic. Telling people that their behavior was fine when it was clearly toxic according to the rules that are actually in place is totally unhelpful.

I clearly stated that it is toxic. Severity of toxicity, according to developer statements, matters. The system's interpretation to severity, I believe, is becoming skewed toward hypersensitivity. Silver412's log is an example of that. Reason being, that this exact log could be the same that his account could be banned for. Being that this forum is about *discussing player behavior*, it's pointless to say my point is not helpful.

The rules ARE UP FOR DISCUSSION. And saying they're being abusive toward some players is not only an entirely legitimate thing to say, but I dare say the system is built for it to become oversensitive. Not intentionally, mind you, but the core of the system *was built overnight* and I don't believe the developers put enough thought and care into it to just let it absorb inane reports over the course of half a decade and still be a fine automated system for discerning what should and shouldn't be banned. Yes, it took months to develop the system initially, but they were surely under pressure to produce results. This was occurring as Tencent was in the final stretches of coming to fully own Riot. They had to get this out fast to increase the value of League of Legends, as it's reputation for toxicity was (and still is) horrendous and they wanted to demonstrate solid progress addressing that. Riot was the only judge and the only say on how effective their system was. And they hailed it with trumpets. 

This ain't no conspiracy. It's just a system, and it's flawed. There have been hardly any statements regarding enhancing or modifying the system since it was released- just upkeep, like making sure memes are included.

The player base is not being conscientious when they hit report, but the system is treating each one with equal severity, learning what 'the player base considers toxic' with increasing imprudence. As more players report without any real objectivity- the bar for passable behavior rises. Have you seen bronze tier play? *Without exception, every Bronze game I've played this season has been toxic!* You should already be aware that I'm forgiving, so that's saying something.

More succinctly, Silver412 *could be banned unfairly* for saying exactly the things he says. Considering that his offenses are minor, and considering he could have poured hundreds of dollars into his account, I do say he is more a victim than offender.

Of course the rules disagree. Don't you dare say the player base is considering Silver412's behavior as unacceptable, because what I have said directly contradicts that and I ask that you respond to that.

Nope! Quite firmly on the side of toxic. Not just a little. Could it be more? Sure. But it could also be a ton less. This kind of chat log is absolutely and correctly punishable, because no reasonable person wants to spend 20 minutes with someone who spends literally the entire time flaming teammates and doesn't use chat for anything the least bit constructive or positive. If OP wants to stop getting punished, yeah, they'll need to reform. If they don't, they'll eventually get permabanned. Do you know how hard it is to get any kind of punishment in this game? I've seen someone spamming slurs in caps while inting 26 deaths in 18 minutes, and they didn't get banned. Seeing that reform card pop up is a _feat_.

We don't need a discussion about how "report this silver garbage noob git gud" shouldn't be punishable.

I don't care if you don't consider it being an asshole; people who don't like dealing with assholes don't want it in our games. Behave according to rules that are really just basic common courtesy, or get out and wave your toxicity flag somewhere else.

OP never even somewhat implied that Yi was a noob. You're adding that in your own head. Seriously. It is not wrong to say "you need to land your critical skillshot", nor is it to say "you need map awareness".

He didn't rant through the game. He made a few points, and repeated himself only once. Calling this log a rant is disrespectful to Silver164. Again you're labelling him as some toxic monster but his log doesn't reflect it.

He even relented on Yi to do whatever he wants. Imagine if he didn't say "report Yi". Would this log even be considerable for punishment? I hardly think so.

You're severely overestimating his toxicity. Isn't it ironic that here you are calling him toxic... when that is pretty much the extent of what Silver said?

Except I'll bet a paycheck that the Yi deserved it far more.


It appears you *want people to be punished* because apparently it's a feat to get people punished. You said it.  You a witch hunter.

Stop it. Look at people fairly. They're real with emotions and they don't all deserve your ire, you're equally guilty as Silver is.

Pah! I'm certainly not being nice to you, your contribution to this 'discussion' has been little more than "you're the enemy". I'm being increasingly impatient with you, and you deserve it.

I am trumpeting that this Silver164 is toxic, but only a little, and you have absolutely nothing to say except "NOOOOO TOXICITY AT ALLLLL I AM A GREAT HUMAN BEING AND ANYONE THAT ISN'T IS PURE EVIL AND MUST REFORM!"

Only mildly exaggerating.

Edit: With that, I think any chance for this evolving into a real discussion is approaching null. Good day, sir. GOOD DAY.

I see the willingness to discuss the system isn't there. I shall accept that you believe the system is flawless. Of course, continue to shake your finger in disgust at everyone who is less than an ideal match for your preferences and believe that you're helping to build a better League.

League will *never* be that place.

I think you're doing us all a disservice. It's ironic that you use a Britney Spears image, it's a more accurate label for your own caliber.

We aren't here discussing my in-game punishments, as I haven't had one in a long time. I know you're looking for people to lash out at, so I'll let your comments pass this time.

I was giving you the benefit of the doubt that **you are not an idiot**, and I was speaking in terms of **when you're in game**.

If an idiot starts flaming you, don't flame them back. Let them be idiots, because there's nothing you can do to change them.

You're doing well, but be aware that some people are deliberately poking you to expose toxic tenancies. Ignore the downvotes, they are from mere rule-glorifying fools who are pointing at you as an example of someone who is getting punished by a system recognizing your "toxic" behavior.

Technically, as you've seen already, it was 'toxic' and justifiably punished. At this point they just want to prove that you deserve it.

I think it's bad behavior (the poking you), take solace that the system isn't designed for you, but for League of Legends, and you being punished is not a indication of you being a bad person.

Yea expecting the jungle to have some map awareness or at the very least look when somebody pings is very demeaning.

This stuff ruins the game, but here we are talking about how you are not allowed to tell people when their actions are ruining your experience.

This is between Silver412 and his team mate and it should stay there. Maybe they learn from that situation maybe not, it's up to them, it's not Riots business and it shouldn't be reportable and the report calling is only a thing because Riot has lowered the bar for reportable stuff so much that it's pretty much nonexistent.

We are at a point were players interact by not communicating and reporting, you can't tell me that this is acceptable in a team game. It's just absurd.

The reports and this disgusting player behavior board (or the legalized pillory how I'd like to call it) is literally part of the problem.

So, I can't ask other players to report someone even though the guy has been flaming at me for 10-15 minutes? I can't also explain for myself because you said this ruins the experience of other players? What truly ruins the experience of all players in the team was the guy who was flaming me for 10-15 minutes. But, I'm the one ruins the experience of other players because I want him to stop flaming at me? 

Then my question here is, can Roit help me look into my instance? If what I said is inappropriate, I believe what the other guy said should be way more severe that I did. If I'm getting the chat restriction, he should also be getting a chat restriction, if not more severe punishment. 

I would also recommend Roit to disable the chat in all matches because 70% of the chat will probably count as negative or arguing. Players use the chat when they have something to say, which isn't happening already, which will probably count as arguing by your standard. I mean people will still say "good job" or "GG“ for 30% of the chat log, but most of the time people want to make a point which, by your standard, is a form of arguing and ruins the experience of other players?

Riot is not going to look into this, remove your punishment, nor tell you what actions were or were not taken against another player's account.

Play through your chat restriction, earn back your honor, and move on.
Don't let people flame you for that long. Mute them.

You are being treated unfairly. You're entirely correct that what you said isn't egregious. As you know, it was mild toxicity at worst, but you're now on the frying pan and have to be a perfect little angel. This is blunt, practical advice- either learn the rules carefully or refrain from chat entirely. Spend a few hours looking at what other people are being punished for, or turn off chat.

The system doesn't punish based on severity alone. It punishes based on consistency x severity, meaning you can be punished for 1 game of extreme toxicity or many many games of mild toxicity.
